sourcesContent:
import { Component, OnInit } from '@angular/core';

@Component({
  selector: 'app-tecnologia',
  templateUrl: './tecnologia.page.html',
  styleUrls: ['./tecnologia.page.scss'],
})
export class TecnologiaPage implements OnInit {

  constructor() { }

  ngOnInit() {
  }

}
<ion-header [translucent]="true">
  <ion-toolbar color="danger">
    <ion-title>Notícias 24 horas</ion-title>
    <ion-label style="font-weight: bold; padding: 5px;" slot="end">Home</ion-label>
    <ion-menu-button slot="start" color="dark"></ion-menu-button>
  </ion-toolbar>
</ion-header>

<ion-content [fullscreen]="true">
  
  <ion-toolbar color="primary" class="titulo_noticia">
    <ion-title style="font-weight: bold; font-size: 18px;">Tecnologia e Pop</ion-title>
   
  </ion-toolbar>
  <!--Tecnologia-->
  <ion-card *ngFor="let n of itens">
    
    <ion-label (click)="openLink(n.link)">
      <ion-card-header color="primary">
        <ion-label class="titulo_noticia">{{n.title}}</ion-label>
      </ion-card-header>
      
      <ion-card-content>
        <ion-img  [src]="n['enclosure']['@attributes']['url']"></ion-img>
        <ion-badge color="danger">{{n.pubDate}}</ion-badge>
        <ion-badge color="primary" style="margin-top: 12px;">Tecmundo</ion-badge>
      </ion-card-content>  
    </ion-label>
    
  </ion-card>
  <ion-infinite-scroll (ionInfinite)="onIonInfinite($event)">
    <ion-infinite-scroll-content></ion-infinite-scroll-content>
  </ion-infinite-scroll>

  

  

</ion-content>
